news_header: A Slovak climber, Ondrej Huserka, died while descending Langtang Lirung in Nepal after a successful ascent.
news_text: Ondrej Huserka, a prominent Slovak mountain climber, tragically died while descending Langtang Lirung in Nepal. After successfully scaling the mountain's eastern face, he fell into a crevasse during the descent. His climbing partner, Marek Holecek, attempted to rescue him but was unable to save him as Huserka became paralyzed from the fall. The Slovak climbers’ association confirmed that adverse weather conditions prevented any rescue efforts. Huserka was recognized as a top alpinist, having completed numerous significant climbs worldwide.
